title: scanvi_scarches
description: Cell type annotation workflow using ScanVI with scArches for reference mapping.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: The query data in .h5mu format with predicted labels predicted from the classifier trained on the reference.
output.help_text: Type: `file`, multiple: `False`, required, default: `"$id.$key.output.h5mu"`, direction: `output`, example: `"output.h5mu"`.

output_obs_predictions.description: In which .obs slot to store the predicted labels.

output_obsm_integrated.description: In which .obsm slot to store the integrated embedding.

output_compression.description: The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

output_model.description: Path to the resulting scANVI model that was updated with query data.

input.description: Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations

layer.description: Which layer to use for integration if .X is not to be used

input_obs_batch_label.description: The .obs field in the input (query) dataset containing the batch labels.

input_obs_size_factor.description: Key in adata.obs for size factor information

input_obs_categorical_covariate.description: Keys in adata.obs that correspond to categorical data

input_obs_continuous_covariate.description: Keys in adata.obs that correspond to continuous data

reference model.title: Reference model
reference model.description: Pre-trained scANVI model to map the query data onto.

reference input.title: Reference input
reference input.description: Reference dataset input arguments to train scANVI model on. Only used if no reference model is provided.

reference.description: Reference dataset consisting of the labeled observations to train the KNN classifier on

reference_obs_target.description: The `.obs` key containing the target labels.

reference_obs_batch_label.description: The .obs field in the reference dataset containing the batch labels.

reference_obs_size_factor.description: Key in adata.obs for size factor information

reference_obs_categorical_covariate.description: Keys in adata.obs that correspond to categorical data

reference_obs_continuous_covariate.description: Keys in adata.obs that correspond to continuous data

unlabeled_category.description: Value in the --reference_obs_batch_label field that indicates unlabeled observations

scvi, scanvi and scarches training optio.title: scVI, scANVI and scArches training options

early_stopping.description: Whether to perform early stopping with respect to the validation set.

early_stopping_monitor.description: Metric logged during validation set epoch.

early_stopping_patience.description: Number of validation epochs with no improvement after which training will be stopped.

early_stopping_min_delta.description: Minimum change in the monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement, i.e

max_epochs.description: Number of passes through the dataset, defaults to (20000 / number of cells) * 400 or 400; whichever is smallest.

reduce_lr_on_plateau.description: Whether to monitor validation loss and reduce learning rate when validation set `lr_scheduler_metric` plateaus.

lr_patience.description: Number of epochs with no improvement after which learning rate will be reduced.

leiden_resolution.description: Control the coarseness of the clustering

knn_n_neighbors.description: The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.
